item.title: 英伟达股价下跌令交易员在 "真空 "状态下关注 100 美元股价水平
item.description: 周二，Nvidia 公司市值锐减 2,790 亿美元，交易员们纷纷在图表上寻找蛛丝马迹，以确定痛苦的终点。【原文：The sharp selloff that wiped a record $279 billion off Nvidia Corp.’s market value on Tuesday has traders scouring charts for clues as to where the pain might end.】

item.title: 长期看好 ASML，警告人工智能潜力被过度炒作
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）结束了两年来对欧洲科技宠儿 ASML Holding NV 的看涨，警告称人工智能的盈利增长潜力正被过度炒作。【原文：UBS Group AG ended a bullish call it’s held for two years on European tech darling ASML Holding NV, warning that the earnings growth potential from artificial intelligence is becoming overhyped.】

item.title: LME 计划采取措施促进月度合约交易
item.description: 伦敦金属交易所正计划采取措施促进其月度合约的电子交易，此举可能会减少作为全球金属行业基准的独特的三个月滚动合约的交易活动。【原文：The London Metal Exchange is planning measures to boost electronic trading in its monthly contracts, a move that may reduce activity in its unique three-month rolling contracts that serve as a benchmark for the global metals industry.】

item.title: 泰晤士水务公司耗资 24 亿英镑的巨型水库项目获得英国批准
item.description: 英国批准了泰晤士水务有限公司（Thames Water Utilities Ltd.）在牛津郡修建一座耗资 24 亿英镑、备受争议的水库的计划，以帮助避免伦敦和英格兰东南部地区在未来几十年内遭受干旱。【原文：The UK approved plans for Thames Water Utilities Ltd. to build a controversial £2.4 billion reservoir in Oxfordshire to help avoid drought in London and southeast England in the coming decades.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率因对美联储行动的预期而继续走低
item.description: 美国抵押贷款利率上周降至 2023 年 4 月以来的最低水平，促使潜在购房者加快申请贷款。【原文：US mortgage rates fell last week to their lowest level since April 2023, prompting potential homebuyers to apply for loans at a faster clip.】

item.title: 与会代表称欧佩克+讨论可能推迟增加石油产量
item.description: 代表们表示，在油价跌至去年以来最低点之后，欧佩克+正在讨论可能推迟原定于10月份进行的石油增产。【原文：OPEC+ is discussing a possible delay to an oil output increase planned for October, delegates said, after prices crashed to the lowest since last year.】

item.title: 肯尼亚国内借贷成本接近 2015 年以来最高水平，国际货币基金组织（IMF）暂缓提供资金
item.description: 肯尼亚的地方借贷成本接近近十年来的最高水平，因为融资方案的不确定性在增加。【原文：Kenya’s local borrowing costs are stuck near the highest in almost a decade as uncertainty over funding options mounts.】

item.title: 研究发现：美国国债清算将增加交易成本
item.description: Coalition Greenwich 的一项最新调查显示，美国国债的强制性中央清算将使市场更加安全，但代价是交易成本的增加和交易量的潜在缩减。【原文：Mandatory central clearing of US Treasuries will make the market safer, but at the expense of costlier trading and potentially curtailed volumes, according to a new Coalition Greenwich survey.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。全球股市延续昨日跌势，科技股首当其冲。由于美国司法部的传票，英伟达（Nvidia）的跌幅更大。与此同时，人们的注意力正转向今天的就业数据，它将为美国经济状况和美联储的利率路径提供进一步的线索。以下是交易员们正在谈论的话题。【原文：Good morning. Global stocks are extending yesterday’s decline with tech shares feeling the brunt of the pain. More so for Nvidia, thanks to a subpoena from the Department of Justice. Meanwhile, attention is turning to today’s jobs data, which will give further clues as to the state of the US economy and the Fed’s rate path. Here’s what traders are talking about. — Morwenna Coniam.】

item.title: 经济衰退忧虑升温，美国债券波动率令欧洲黯然失色
item.description: 有迹象表明，美国这个世界最大的经济体正步履蹒跚，这助长了对美联储大幅降息的押注，因此，债券交易商正准备迎接美国市场比欧洲更为剧烈的波动。【原文：Bond traders are bracing for wilder market swings in the US than in Europe, as signs the world’s largest economy is faltering fuel bets on a jumbo interest-rate cut from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，如果新日铁交易失败，美国钢铁公司将关闭工厂
item.description: 美国钢铁公司首席执行官大卫-伯里特（David Burritt）告诉《华尔街日报》，如果出售给新日铁（Nippon Steel）的计划失败，美国钢铁公司将关闭工厂，并可能将总部迁出匹兹堡。【原文：US Steel would close mills and likely move its headquarters out of Pittsburgh if its planned sale to Nippon Steel falls apart, CEO David Burritt told the Wall Street Journal.】

item.title: 南非经济转好，商业情绪接近两年高点
item.description: 受持续电力供应恢复、对经济的乐观情绪以及 5 月 29 日大选后政治确定性的支撑，南非商业景气上升至近两年来的新高。【原文：South African business sentiment rose to an almost two-year high, underpinned by the return of sustained power supply, optimism about the economy and political certainty after May 29 elections.】

item.title: 哈里斯计划提高住房自有率。建筑商股票欢欣鼓舞
item.description: 由于美联储预计将在几周内开始降息，住宅建筑类股票一路高歌猛进。如果副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）在 11 月的总统大选中获胜，她将计划支持美国住房市场，这也为该集团带来了额外的利好。【原文：Homebuilding stocks are on a tear with the Federal Reserve expected to start cutting interest rates in a matter of weeks. And the group is catching an additional tailwind from Vice President Kamala Harris’ plans to support the US housing market if she wins the presidential election in November.】

item.title: 在美上市的中国股票接近纳斯达克同业最便宜水平
item.description: 对中国经济的担忧促使中国在美国上市的股票接近纳斯达克 100 指数的最大折价率。【原文：Concerns over China’s economy are the driving the nation’s US-listed stocks to trade near their biggest discount to the Nasdaq 100 Index.】

item.title: 抢购优质债券，阿联酋债券创三年来最长涨势
item.description: 随着美国国债收益率的暴跌，新兴市场中评级较高的借款国纷纷涌向安全市场，阿拉伯联合酋长国从中受益最大。【原文：The United Arab Emirates is benefiting the most among higher-rated borrowers in emerging markets as a plunge in US Treasury yields drives a rush into safety.】

item.title: 法国央行行长勾画预算可信度之路
item.description: 法国央行行长弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）勾画了修复国家财政的路线图，并敦促在埃马纽埃尔-马克龙总统在任命新总理问题上继续犹豫不决之际迅速采取行动恢复公信力。【原文：Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau sketched out a road map for repairing the country’s finances and urged quick action to restore credibility as President Emmanuel Macron continues to hesitate over appointing a new prime minister.】

item.title: Adnoc 以三笔美元交易亮相债券市场
item.description: 阿布扎比的主要石油生产商阿德诺克公司（Adnoc）启动了首次债券销售，加入了全球发债热潮，因为各公司都希望锁定有利的借贷成本。【原文：Abu Dhabi’s main oil producer Adnoc kicked off its inaugural bond sale, joining a global rush of debt issuance as companies look to lock in favorable borrowing costs.】

item.title: 南非铁路和电力改造取决于杜绝电缆盗窃行为
item.description: 南非最大的两家国有企业多年来饱受腐败和盗窃之害，它们的复苏有赖于一个共同的组成部分：保护数千英里的电缆免遭盗窃，并铺设更多电缆。【原文：The recovery of South Africa’s two biggest state-owned companies — beset by years of corruption and theft — relies on one common component: protecting thousands of miles of cables from theft and rolling out more.】

item.title: 挪威8月份房价止跌回升
item.description: 挪威上个月调整后的房价出现反弹，这表明即使降息预期被推迟，这个北欧国家的房地产市场依然强劲。【原文：Norway’s adjusted home prices rebounded last month, confirming that the housing market in the Nordic nation remains robust even as expectations of interest-rate cuts have been delayed.】

item.title: 大众汽车称欧洲汽车销售疲软导致两家工厂空置
item.description: 大众汽车公司（Volkswagen AG）为其考虑史无前例地关闭德国工厂的计划进行了辩护，称汽车销量下滑已使公司拥有的两家工厂数量过多。【原文：Volkswagen AG defended plans to consider unprecedented factory closures in Germany, saying flagging car sales have left the company with about two plants too many.】

item.title: 摒弃中国的新兴市场股票基金发行量将创年度新高
item.description: 新的新兴市场股票基金如雨后春笋般涌现，其中不包括中国市场，这些基金的年发行量已经超过了去年创下的纪录，因为在中国资产长期低迷的情况下，投资者在其他地方寻求更好的回报。【原文：New emerging-market equity funds that exclude China are sprouting up, already matching their annual launch record set last year as investors seek better returns elsewhere amid an extended slump in the nation’s assets.】

item.title: 人工智能贸易不景气，外资流出创台湾股市新高
item.description: 在对人工智能行业过热的担忧再次引发全球股市大跌之后，外国投资者撤出台湾科技股市场的数量创下新高。【原文：Foreign investors pulled out of Taiwan’s technology-heavy stock market in record numbers after renewed concerns about overheating in the artificial intelligence sector fueled a global rout.】

item.title: 中国电动车和混合动力车销量将超越汽油车
item.description: 8 月份，中国的电动汽车和混合动力汽车销量可能激增，连续第二个月超过了增长乏力的传统汽油汽车。【原文：Sales of electric and hybrid vehicles in China likely surged in August, surpassing faltering deliveries of conventional gasoline cars for the second month in a row.】

item.title: Park Square 为新的私人信贷工具融资 34 亿欧元
item.description: 欧洲私人信贷专业公司 Park Square Capital 的管理合伙人罗宾-杜马（Robin Doumar）表示，该公司已为一个新的直接借贷工具筹集了 34 亿欧元（38 亿美元）的资金。【原文：European private credit specialist Park Square Capital has raised €3.4 billion ($3.8 billion) for a new direct-lending vehicle, according to its managing partner Robin Doumar.】

item.title: 中国考虑分两步下调房贷利率以保护银行利益
item.description: 中国正在考虑分两步下调多达 5.3 万亿美元抵押贷款的利率，以降低数百万家庭的借贷成本，同时减轻银行系统的利润压力。【原文：China is considering cutting interest rates on as much as $5.3 trillion of mortgages in two steps to lower borrowing costs for millions of families while mitigating the profit squeeze on its banking system.】

item.title: 国际原子能机构称乌克兰的核脆弱性延伸至电网
item.description: 联合国核监察机构正在扩大其在乌克兰的监督范围，将对维护该国大部分发电量的原子工厂的安全至关重要的高压电力网络也纳入监督范围。【原文：The United Nations nuclear watchdog is widening its oversight in Ukraine to include high-voltage power networks critical to maintaining safety at atomic plants that generate the bulk of the country’s electricity.】

item.title: 企业家对工党的资本利得税计划敲响警钟
item.description: 投资者和企业家警告说，如果工党政府在 10 月份的预算中提高资本利得税，英国将失去快速发展的初创企业。【原文：Investors and entrepreneurs have warned Britain will lose fast-growing startups if the Labour government raises capital gains tax in its October budget.】

item.title: 外国投资者一天内抢购 10 亿美元韩国债券
item.description: 据韩国金融监督管理局（Financial Supervisory Service）称，周二流入韩国债券的外资激增，净买入额超过 10 亿美元，为 11 月以来最多。【原文：Foreign inflows into South Korean bonds surged on Tuesday, with net buying topping $1 billion, the most since November, according to the Financial Supervisory Service.】

item.title: 铁矿石逼近 90 美元，中国钢铁需求面临风险
item.description: 铁矿石跌至2022年以来的最低点，因为人们担心中国受困于危机的钢铁行业，这种炼钢材料扩大了抛售范围。【原文：Iron ore sank closer to its lowest since 2022 as the steelmaking material extended a selloff on fears for China’s crisis-wracked steel industry.】

item.title: 乌克兰面临国际货币基金组织要求货币贬值和削减利率的压力
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，乌克兰官员预计国际货币基金组织本周将推动其加快货币贬值、降低利率并加强税收力度，以填补该国的预算缺口。【原文：Ukrainian officials are expecting the International Monetary Fund this week to push it to devalue its currency faster, cut interest rates and strengthen its tax-raising efforts to fill the country’s budget gap, according to people familiar with the situation.】
